intro: Bignonia cuprea var. grandiflora, commonly known as the scarlet trumpetbush, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking orange-red, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy or loamy soils. This species is often cultivated for its vibrant floral display and ornamental value in gardens.
